name: places/ChIJR6sUC7JZwokRuLZFMpoMEtQ
formattedAddress: 333 W 34th St. 6th Floor, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 333 W 34th St. 6th Floor, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Veteran chain specializing in gourmet Belgian chocolates, truffles, cocoa & other sweet gift items.

originalText.text:
I used to work here maybe 15 years ago at an actual location, and man they ain't what they used to be. The options online are dwindling (Cherry cordials have been out of stock for at least a few months) and they make you buy some of the smaller items in bulk. No thank you I do not want to buy 24 chocolate bars in bulk for 70 something dollars. If we're willing to pay shipping, why not just send however many we would like to purchase? Or maybe offer a smaller bulk that's more manageable for the average person, like 5 to 10 bars? We're not trying to stock a store ourselves and don't need that many.  In addition, people would go nuts for a "build your own box" where you can pick the pieces and pay what that amounts to in weight like they used to have in-store. I understand that might not be feasible, but the personalization and options are lacking at this point.

I had a good experience with customer service over the phone when I needed it though as a positive point!

originalText.text: I placed the order one week ago, but received nothing after one week. So I contacted the customer service, then they said there was no order in your account. Then I sent them the screenshot for my account to show them I placed the order. Then they admitted that oh, it was a system error. They did not receive the order information. Then they asked me to place a new order, and it took me about an hour for the new order in the chat, and I did not receive the confirmation email after I made the payment. So I contacted them again, and after receiving the email I found out they placed a wrong item for me. Then I had to contact them again to make the correction, they said no changes could be made. Then I requested to cancel the order, they said that was not an option. This is really the worst shopping experience I ever had. No one from the CS team is helpful.

originalText.text: Every year I order about 20 boxes to be delivered to friends and mostly to doctors, therapists and others who have helped during the year. This year 2 boxes were not delivered . One UPS called and said they were sending back to Godiva and Ashley said I would receive a refund and nothing. Another shows delivered but the receipient checked with building management and nothing. Can't get a straight answer and you can only e mail or text. Really poor service from a customer who puts in that many orders every year.

originalText.text: I purchase chocolate for the holidays yearly . This time I have applied a discount coupon, and it turned out they ran out of the brand I have ordered. They called me to change my order, and I ordered a different brand, however they refused to apply the discount coupon as they said it was already used.  Not fair.

text.text: I purchase chocolate for the holidays yearly . This time I have applied a discount coupon, and it turned out they ran out of the brand I have ordered. They called me to change my order, and I ordered a different brand, however they refused to apply the discount coupon as they said it was already used.  Not fair.

originalText.text:
Terrible service. I placed an order on Thur. I paid $22 extra for 2 day service. As of the following Wed my order still has not arrived.  I contacted customer service and they said Wed is the 2nd day because Fri, Sat, Sun and Mon DO NOT count as business days. Therefore Tues is day 1 and Wed is day 2. WHAT!? Fri and Mon are not business days!? So paying extra for 2 day delivery was a complete waste of money. A so called 2 day order can actually take 6 days and the company will argue how it is still only 2 days. Toilet paper math! Never again.

I have since discovered See's Candy. They are terrific!
